main event: A bright light, comparable in size to the first magnitude star, was observed moving steadily in the Pacific Ocean on July 16, 1963.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 5 minutes before the object faded at the horizon., The object was observed traveling on a southerly course., The sighting was categorized as a visual observation., The report was sourced from military communications., The satellite ECHO I was evaluated to be the probable cause of the sighting.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
